issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

fields.description: During a successful startup of the imaging worker, we see a few errors that could be interpreted as problematic but appear not to be. Removing spurious errors makes it easier to identify actual problems when necessary. Specifically the 'cannot access /mnt/imaging' and the '403 Forbidden' messages below are at issue here: {code:java} [cloud-user@euca-10-111-30-90 ~]$ sudo cat /var/log/eucalyptus-imaging-worker/worker.log 2016-02-16 07:40:37,973 worker [INFO]:Adder remote sys log handler 2016-02-16 07:40:38,055 worker [INFO]:Starting daemonized worker process 2016-02-16 07:40:38,165 worker [DEBUG]:(None, 'ls: cannot access /mnt/imaging: No such file or directory\n') 2016-02-16 07:40:38,188 worker [DEBUG]:main loop running with instance_id=i-5f7310ae 2016-02-16 07:40:38,189 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task 2016-02-16 07:40:38,254 boto [ERROR]:403 Forbidden 2016-02-16 07:40:38,255 boto [ERROR]:403 ForbiddenMessage has expired (times in UTC): Timestamp=null Expires=null Deadline=2016-02-16T07:55:58Message has expired (times in UTC): Timestamp=null Expires=null Deadline=2016-02-16T07:55:58 2016-02-16 07:40:38,259 worker [ERROR]:Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/worker/main_loop.py", line 53, in start import_task = con.get_import_task() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/worker/ws/__init__.py", line 169, in get_import_task task = self.conn.get_object('GetInstanceImportTask', params, InstanceImportTask, verb='POST') File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/connection.py", line 1208, in get_object raise self.ResponseError(response.status, response.reason, body) EC2ResponseError: EC2ResponseError: 403 Forbidden 403 ForbiddenMessage has expired (times in UTC): Timestamp=null Expires=null Deadline=2016-02-16T07:55:58Message has expired (times in UTC): Timestamp=null Expires=null Deadline=2016-02-16T07:55:58 Failed to query imaging service: EC2ResponseError: 403 Forbidden 403 ForbiddenMessage has expired (times in UTC): Timestamp=null Expires=null Deadline=2016-02-16T07:55:58Message has expired (times in UTC): Timestamp=null Expires=null Deadline=2016-02-16T07:55:58 2016-02-16 15:40:46,012 worker [INFO]:Adder remote sys log handler 2016-02-16 15:41:10,077 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task 2016-02-16 15:41:40,500 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task 2016-02-16 15:42:10,688 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task 2016-02-16 15:42:40,882 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging fields.summary: Clean up spurious errors in imaging worker startup logs

comments.body: The 21b26a70a632935170c2d5ca21a4654064966b99 triggers ntp update before service start up. This would not 100% protect against the error mentioned in the bug but should help.

The "403 Forbidden" message disappeared. Still seeing {{/mnt/imaging: No such file or directory}} in the log.

{code}
2016-08-04 20:55:52,936 worker [INFO]:Adder remote sys log handler
2016-08-04 20:55:53,032 worker [INFO]:Starting daemonized imaging worker process
2016-08-04 20:55:53,129 worker [DEBUG]:(None, 'ls: cannot access /mnt/imaging: No such file or directory\n')
2016-08-04 20:55:53,145 worker [DEBUG]:main loop running with instance_id=i-74e45fa0
2016-08-04 20:55:53,145 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task
{code}

[~vasya], [~mbacchi], not sure, if we would like to solve this issue or keep re-open for the missing directory issue. Let me know what do you guy think?

*Installed Packages*
{code}
Name        : eucalyptus-service-image
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.4
Release     : 0.118.4.20160802git98b0ae0.el7

Repo        : installed
{code}
